newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Sao Paulo firms hire 557 workers in May - Fiesp.
newsitem.headline: Sao Paulo firms hire 557 workers in May - Fiesp.

text.p: Private firms in Sao Paulo state hired 557 employees in May, against 10,840 workers sacked in April, a spokeswoman for Sao Paulo State Industries Federation (Fiesp) said.
It was the first month since March 1995 that hirings surpassed dismissals in Sao Paulo state's industrial private firms, she added.
Last month, 26 out of the 47 sectors included in the survey hired new personnel. Fourteen sacked people and seven maintained their staff unchanged.
In the last 12 months, Sao Paulo firms have sacked 102,738 workers, or 5.23 percent of Sao Paulo's industrial workforce.
So far this year, Sao Paulo industries have laid off 36,298 workers, or 1.93 percent of the Sao Paulo's industrial workforce, she added.
